item.title: Report E-2024010201
item.description:
Report E-2024010201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 5, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon liter plastic jugs of UN3149 leaked due to improper loading and released approximately one (1) liter of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected and containerized all impacted cardboard and debris into one (1) vented 55-gallon poly drum. The two (2) damaged 5-liter jugs were placed into one (1) other vented 55-gallon poly drum. Both drums were labeled as hazardous and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024010286
item.description:
Report E-2024010286

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was patched and placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2024010152
item.description:
Report E-2024010152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of uN266 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one-quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked the pallet, removed one (1) leaking 5-gallon pail of UN3266 corrosive liquid from the load, and placed it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted trailer and swept them up with hand tools. Crews then wiped down the impacted surfaces and freight with a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into the one (1) 35-gallon drum, and both 35-gallon drums generated during this cleanup were staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024010123
item.description:
Report E-2024010123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1219 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one-halt (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail, all UN1219 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal purposes by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024010332
item.description:
Report E-2024010332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of 1gal of Chemlok 205 (UN1133) from one 5gal metal pail which was punctured by a forklift during dock ops at XCO spilling to the dock floor. The SDS for the material was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal could safely clean the spill with the PPE available on site, storing the total waste into one 35gal poly drum and left in the terminal waste area.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE BOTTOM HAS A PUNCTURE THAT ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED UPSIDE DOWN TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE
